decision_conditions: The tree(s) to be pruned shall be crown lifted as per the approved specification / to a maximum height of m. This work shall involve the tip reduction of low hanging branches and/or the removal of low branches to the height specified and result in a tree of balanced appearance; those branches to be removed shall be removed at their origin and all branch collars shall be left intact.

The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS 3998:2010 'Tree work - Recommendations'. Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of this work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
The works hereby permitted shall be carried out within 2 years of the date of this consent.
To enable the Local Planning Authority to reconsider the appropriateness of the works in the light of any change in circumstances.

The tree(s) to be pruned shall be crown reduced as per the approved specification / by a maximum of [    ]m. This work shall comprise a reduction in both height and spread over the whole crown by shortening or removing peripheral branches in a uniform and systematic manner.  Where branches are shortened, they should be cut back to a suitably positioned secondary branch.

Crown reduction shall not be construed as 'lopping' or 'topping' and shall result in a tree of typical form for the species and of balanced appearance. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained in BS 3998:2010 'Tree work - Recommendations'. Climbing irons or 'spikes' shall not be used during the execution of the work.
In order to protect health of the tree and the visual amenity of the area.
description: Hold for testing - testing Tree Application TPO
